TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit SeekableXPathNavigator extends System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator

Docs.summary: Provides read-only, random access to data contained in XML documents and enables efficient querying for specified nodes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SOAP messages passed between parts of the [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] system are handled by various components of the system that must inspect these messages to determine what actions to take in processing them. The XPath engine is a component that queries messages for this purpose and it requires a navigator to read SOAP messages and other XML documents. A navigator provides a cursor that moves from node to node tracking where the XML document is actually being read.
The XPath engine works with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator>, which extends the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> class by adding a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator.CurrentPosition%2A> property. This property allows positions within the XML document to be saved and loaded quickly without having to clone the navigator, an expensive memory allocation that the <xref:System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator> requires for such an operation. The XPath engine must frequently record the position of the cursor in the course of executing queries on XML documents, so the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator> provides an important optimization for message processing.
Note that the value of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator.CurrentPosition%2A> property is implementation-specific and may not map to node position or character position. Its value is only meaningful to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.SeekableXPathNavigator> implementation (and instance) that supplied it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Xml.XmlNodeOrder ComparePosition (long first, long second);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Xml.XmlNodeOrder ComparePosition(int64 first, int64 second) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns a value that describes the document order of the two specified positions.
Docs.returns: One of the values that describes the relation of to in the document.

block.para: This method should throw an exception for invalid position values.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract long CurrentPosition { get; set; }

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets a value associated with the node in the data where the XPath navigator is positioned.
Docs.value: A value that is associated with the navigator’s current position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `set` operation moves the navigator to the position associated with the value specified. The `get` operation returns a value associated with the current position of the navigator.

block.para:
This property does not have any intrinsic meaning: it is an opaque value that an implementation associates with the navigator’s current position. No restrictions or requirements are placed on the value itself. No assumptions about its internal data structure can be made.
It is not required that the values be sequential, or even that a navigator position map to a unique value. Multiple values can refer to the same navigator position, so comparing two values does not provide useful information.
Any value supplied by a operation must be valid for a operation. It is not necessarily an error for a operation to use a value not first acquired by a operation. A value not returned by that has been acquired some other way may or may not be considered valid by the implementation: this choice is up to the implementer.
The meaning of a value must not change during the life of its navigator while it navigates the same document. Also, the meaning of values must be shared by any two navigators that are related by cloning, again, provided they still navigate the same document. All values supplied by a operation must remain valid for the life of a navigator and any of its clones as long as the instance still navigates the same document.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetLocalName(int64 node_position) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the local name of the node at the position specified.
Docs.returns: The local name of the node at the specified position. is returned if the node does not have a local name, for example if the current position references a text node.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetName(int64 node_position) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the name of the node at the specified position.
Docs.returns: The name of the node at . is returned if the node does not have a name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The name is the name of the XML element at `nodePosition` and typically includes a namespace prefix.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetNamespace(int64 node_position) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the namespace of the node at the specified position.
Docs.returns: The namespace of the node at . is returned if the node does not have a namespace.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Xml.XPath.XPathNodeType GetNodeType(int64 node_position) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the type of the node at the specified position.
Docs.returns: One of the values that indicate the type of the XML node.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetValue(int64 node_position) cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the text value of the node at the specified position.
Docs.returns: The text value of the node at . is returned if the node does not have a text value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For elements, this method returns the concatenation of all text descendents of the node at the specified position, similar to the <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement.InnerText%2A> property.
